methods.name: index
methods.full_description:
Retrieve Bucketlists

This endpoint is used to retrieve all bucketlists. It optionally takes params to return the bucketlist in pages and the limit of bucketlists to fetch per request. It could also be queried with an ownership params (o) to return all bucketlists that match the params or with keywords “mine” (returns only your bucketlists) or “not_mine” (returns bucketlists that are not yours)

Authentication token has to be passed as part of the request. It must be passed as HTTP header(TOKEN).

params.name: o
params.description: ownership params for a bucketlist. Can be ‘user’ or ‘not_user’

examples:
// Returns 401 for invalid token
GET /v1/bucketlists?q
200

methods.name: create
methods.full_description:
Create new Bucketlist

This endpoint is used to create a new bucketlist. It requires a name for the new bucketlist.

Authentication token has to be passed as part of the request. It must be passed as HTTP header(TOKEN).

methods.name: show
methods.full_description:
Show details of a Bucketlist

This endpoint is used to retrieve more details of a given bucketlist such as created_at. It requires a valid user bucketlist id

Authentication token has to be passed as part of the request. It must be passed as HTTP header(TOKEN).

params.name: id
params.description: Id of the user bucketlist to fetch.

methods.name: update
methods.full_description:
Update a Bucketlist

This endpoint is used to update the details of a given bucketlist. It requires a valid user bucketlist id and new name for the bucketlist.

Authentication token has to be passed as part of the request. It must be passed as HTTP header(TOKEN).

methods.name: destroy
methods.full_description:
Destroy a Bucketlist

This endpoint is used to delete a bucketlist and all it’s associated items.

Authentication token has to be passed as part of the request. It must be passed as HTTP header(TOKEN).

methods.name: index
methods.full_description:
Retrieve items

This endpoint is used to retrieve the items in a given checklist. It optionally takes params to return the items in pages and the limit of items to fetch per request. If not provided it defaults to 20 items per query. The max allowed number of items that can be fetched per request is 100. It could also be queried with a status params (i.e ‘done’ or ‘pending’) to return all items that match the params.

Authentication token has to be passed as part of the request. It must be passed as HTTP header(TOKEN).

params.name: checklist_id
params.description: Id of the checklist item belongs to

methods.name: create
methods.full_description:
Create new Item

This endpoint is used to create a new item in the given checklist. It requires a name for the new item. Optionally, you can specify whether the item has been completed (true) or not (false).

Authentication token has to be passed as part of the request. It must be passed as HTTP header(TOKEN).

params.name: checklist_id
params.description: Id of the checklist item belongs to

params.name: done
params.description: Status of the item. Has it been completed? ‘true’ or ‘false’

methods.name: show
methods.full_description:
Show details of an Item

This endpoint is used to retrieve more details of a given item such as created_at, completed status. It requires a valid checklist id and item id

Authentication token has to be passed as part of the request. It must be passed as HTTP header(TOKEN).

params.name: checklist_id
params.description: Id of the checklist item belongs to

methods.name: destroy
methods.full_description:
Destroy an item

This endpoint is used to delete a checklist item.

Authentication token has to be passed as part of the request. It must be passed as HTTP header(TOKEN).

params.name: checklist_id
params.description: Id of the checklist item belongs to

methods.name: update
methods.full_description:
Update an Item

This endpoint is used to update the details of a given checklist item. It requires a valid checklist id and new name (and ‘done’ status) for the item.

Authentication token has to be passed as part of the request. It must be passed as HTTP header(TOKEN).

params.name: checklist_id
params.description: Id of the checklist item belongs to

methods.name: create
methods.full_description:
Create User

This endpoint is used to create a new user profile.

methods.name: update
methods.full_description:
Update User Profile

This endpoint is used to update the user profile details.

Authentication token has to be passed as part of the request. It must be passed as HTTP header(TOKEN).

methods.name: login
methods.full_description:
Authenticate User

This endpoint is used to authenticate a user account.

errors.description: Query params could not be processed. User not yet created or invalid params provided.

methods.name: logout
methods.full_description:
Logout user

This endpoint is used to terminate access to an authenticated account by invalidating the token if it has not expired.

Authentication token has to be passed as part of the request. It must be passed as HTTP header(TOKEN).
examples:
GET /auth/logout
401
